channel.title: Aaaaahhhhhh!
channel.description: sorry i had to get that scream out:D ok so about 1 to 2 weeks ago i came home from school and something smelled like smoke. nope not the oven or stove, but my computer. dont feel like explaining it all and i know you guys dont wanna read it all, so ill make a long story short. my hard drive pretty much just blew up, so i had to get a new HD and i lost everything (yep im a dumbass and didnt back my things up). it screwed my computer up and i've had a hell of a time getting it working again. the only good thing i got out of this was that my mom finally came to her senses and got rid of dial-up and we now have comcast!!! yeah but just a lil help please; i had limewire PRO but of course dont know, so can anyone tell me how to get it again?(i previously got it from the n@n.com thing) thanks for any help.

item.title: Aaaaahhhhhh!
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

g00dg0d:

There was some newspaper article that said that hackers can now make scripts that do something inside your computer that makes it blow up like a grenade… be happy that didnt happen.

oo yeah that wouldnt be too good. and yeah the guy at the geek squad told me the clanking noises meant that it was just fried.

Read full topic

item.title: Aaaaahhhhhh!
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Yea thats what I was afraid of. Would it be feasible for me to buy a similar hard drive and swap the disks?

Read full topic

item.title: Aaaaahhhhhh!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Send it to a specialist data recovery company, and give them large wads of cash. They have at least a 50% chance of actually getting your shit back.

Read full topic

item.title: Aaaaahhhhhh!
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Yo that happened to me too. But instead, my hard drive failed. There was some clanking noises, and now everything from sophomore year is lost. If anyone has any ideas how to fix this, hit me up.

Read full topic

item.title: Aaaaahhhhhh!
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“mjordan, post:9, topic:48794”][quote author=therealjdb link=topic=68424.msg787363#msg787363 date=1169112691]
no problem just used the search button
[/quote]

o lol im stupid:o. ive been around for forever and didnt even think about that. i know theres prolly no way of getting these back but i lost a hell of alot of old school scripts that ive collected from way back ever since i was a little leecher on kaits( i guess im just SOL). and also i know that there is a way(i think) to get my music off my ipod back into itunes. do i need to buy a certain cable or anything for this?[/quote]

I think you just plug your ipod in then update your library. That should put all your songs back on.

Read full topic
